articles.author: SHARON LaFRANIERE
articles.title: Top Trump Campaign Aides Are Portrayed as Corrupt at Manafort Trial
articles.description: Rick Gates, a top campaign aide to President Trump, detailed in federal court on Tuesday a multiyear fraud by the former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort. The defense took aim at Mr. Gates’s credibility.

articles.author: ANNIE CORREAL and EMILY COCHRANE
articles.title: Melania Trump’s Parents Become U.S. Citizens as Lawyer Acknowledges ‘Chain Migration’
articles.description: Viktor and Amalija Knavs had a private naturalization ceremony in Lower Manhattan, after being sponsored by their daughter in a program President Trump has railed against.

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER BUSKIRK
articles.title: Let’s Not Throw the Word Treason Around
articles.description: President Trump received a warm welcome on Saturday when he arrived for a rally at Olentangy Orange High School in Lewis Center, Ohio.

articles.author: MICHAEL D. SHEAR
articles.title: President Admits Focus of Trump Tower Meeting Was Getting Dirt on Clinton
articles.description: President Trump with his son Donald Jr. last month. Mr. Trump denied a report that he is worried about the legal exposure for his son, who hosted a June 2016 meeting between some of Mr. Trump’s top campaign advisers and a Kremlin-connected lawyer.

articles.author: JOUMANA KHATIB and LANCE BOOTH
articles.title: Trump, Russia, Apple: Your Weekend Briefing
articles.description: Here’s what you need to know about the week’s top stories.

articles.author: BRAD PLUMER
articles.title: Trump Officials Link Fuel Economy Rules to Deadly Crashes. Experts Are Skeptical.
articles.description: Traffic at the Williamsburg Bridge in Brooklyn. Trump administration officials assert that lighter vehicles will lead to more accident fatalities.

articles.author: JOUMANA KHATIB and MARCUS PAYADUE
articles.title: Space Force, Trump, Yemen: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
articles.description: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

articles.author: EMILY COCHRANE
articles.title: ‘They Can Make Anything Bad’: Trump Bashes a Familiar Foe
articles.description: For much of a rally on Thursday night in Pennsylvania, President Trump focused on his multiple grievances with the Washington press corps.

articles.author: LINDA QIU
articles.title: Fact Check of the Day: Trump’s Inaccurate Claims About Highways, Immigration and Beyoncé From a Pennsylvania Rally
articles.description: President Trump said his campaign rallies drew larger crowds than concerts for Beyoncé, Jay-Z and Bruce Springsteen. That was one of 15 inaccurate claims he made.

articles.author: GIOVANNI RUSSONELLO
articles.title: Best of Late Night: Kimmel Hammers Trump for Changing His Story on 2016 Meeting
articles.description: Jimmy Kimmel took aim at the president for tweeting that Donald Trump Jr. met with Russian officials before the election “to get information on an opponent.”

articles.author: CORAL DAVENPORT
articles.title: Trump Unveils His Plan to Weaken Car Pollution Rules
articles.description: The proposal would freeze rules requiring automakers to build more efficient cars and challenge the right of individual states to set their own emissions standards.

articles.author: JONATHAN MARTIN
articles.title: Trump Backs Kris Kobach in Kansas Race, Against Republican Advice
articles.description: In providing his support in the governor’s race, the president ignored concerns that Mr. Kobach’s hard-right positions are too polarizing for a general election

articles.author: CATIE EDMONDSON
articles.title: Trump Administration Moves Ahead With Tariffs on Canadian Newsprint
articles.description: The tariffs are lower than what the Commerce Department initially imposed, but the decision is still a blow to the American newspaper industry, which is already struggling with declining revenue.

articles.author: CORAL DAVENPORT and INYOUNG KANG
articles.title: California Today: California Today: What Trump’s Auto Emissions Plan Means for California
articles.description: Early morning rush hour traffic on the Hollywood Freeway. A Trump administration proposal would revoke a legal waiver granted to California that lets it set its own pollution standards.

articles.author: HENRY OLSEN
articles.title: The Voters Who Will Decide the Midterms
articles.description: Some people changed which party’s nominee they voted for from 2012 to 2016, and they, not the party bases, are key to who wins the House and Senate.

articles.author: HELENE COOPER and JULIAN E. BARNES
articles.title: U.S. Officials Scrambled Behind the Scenes to Shield NATO Deal From Trump
articles.description: John R. Bolton, the national security adviser, pushed NATO ambassadors to finish a critical policy document before the alliance’s summit meeting last month so the president could not reject it.

articles.author: ALAN FEUER
articles.title: Ex-‘Manhattan Madam’ to Appear Before Grand Jury in Russia Investigation
articles.description: Kristin M. Davis, known in New York tabloids as the “Manhattan Madam,” will appear on Friday before a federal grand jury. One possible line of inquiry is her connections to Roger J. Stone Jr., a veteran political consultant and Trump adviser.

articles.title: New York Congressman Chris Collins Is Charged With Insider Trading
articles.description: Representative Collins, one of President Trump’s earliest and most vocal supporters, is accused of using inside information about a new drug to avoid losses.

articles.author: MITCH SMITH
articles.title: In Kansas, Another Close Race, as Kobach and Colyer Remain Deadlocked
articles.description: After a long night of waiting for results, Kansas gubernatorial candidate Kris Kobach, with his wife, Heather, told supporters the election was too close to call early Wednesday.

articles.author: GIOVANNI RUSSONELLO
articles.title: Best of Late Night: Trevor Noah Wonders if Paul Manafort Is Secretly Proud of Rick Gates
articles.description: “This is hilarious,” Trevor Noah said of Rick Gates’s testimony against his former boss, Paul Manafort. “He’s confessing to stealing from the same guy that he was committing crimes with.”
